title: How to estimate elastic shape means with elastes
text: Like many R packages, simplest way obtain elastes install directly CRAN. Type following command R console:
code: install.packages("elastes")

title: How to estimate elastic shape means with elastes
text: purpose section give users general sense package. briefly go main functions, basic operations outputs Firstly, load elastes package. load set 30 sparse handwritten digit 3’s shapes package illustration. may install shapes package first. data still form three dimensional array. convert list data.frames, data.frame corresponds one curve. can compute functional mean curve calling compute_elastic_shape_mean specifiying set knots used type mean. estimate plot smooth mean using 11 equidistant knots. call plot.elastic_shape_mean shows estimated mean function, together called Procrustes fits - centered rotation plus scaling aligned data curves.  estimate plot polygonal mean using 13 equidistant knots.
code: library(elastes) # install.packages("shapes") library(shapes) #> Warning in rgl.init(initValue, onlyNULL): RGL: unable to open X11 display #> Warning: 'rgl.init' failed, running with 'rgl.useNULL = TRUE'. data(digit3.dat) digit3 <- apply(digit3.dat, MARGIN = 3, FUN = function(curve){   data.frame(X1 = curve[,1], X2 = curve[,2]) }) mean_smooth <- compute_elastic_shape_mean(   digit3,    knots = seq(0, 1, length = 11),    type = "smooth" ) plot(mean_smooth, main = "smooth mean") mean_poly <- compute_elastic_shape_mean(   digit3,    knots = seq(0, 1, length = 13),   type = "polygon" ) plot(mean_poly, col = "blue", main = "polygonal mean")

title: How to estimate elastic shape means with elastes
text: estimated mean leading eigenfunction smoothed Hermitian covariance surface data curves. covariance estimation, used penalty can controlled penalty parameter. method can control different types measurement-error variance along t, setting var_type parameter. See also documentation information.
code: help(compute_elastic_shape_mean)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Manuel Pfeuffer. Author, maintainer. Lisa Steyer. Author. Almond Stoecker. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Stöcker , Pfeuffer M, Steyer L, Greven S (2022). “Elastic Full Procrustes Analysis Plane Curves via Hermitian Covariance Smoothing.” doi:10.48550/ARXIV.2203.10522. Pfeuffer M, Steyer L, Stoecker (????). elastes: Elastic Full Procrustes Means Sparse Irregular Planar Curves. R package version 0.1.5.9000, https://mpff.github.io/elastes/.
code: @Misc{,   title = {Elastic Full Procrustes Analysis of Plane Curves via Hermitian Covariance Smoothing},   author = {Almond Stöcker and Manuel Pfeuffer and Lisa Steyer and Sonja Greven},   year = {2022},   publisher = {arXiv},   doi = {10.48550/ARXIV.2203.10522}, } @Manual{,   title = {elastes: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves},   author = {Manuel Pfeuffer and Lisa Steyer and Almond Stoecker},   note = {R package version 0.1.5.9000},   url = {https://mpff.github.io/elastes/}, }

what: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves
title: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves
text: elastes R package provides functions computation functional elastic shape means sets open planar curves. package particularly suitable settings curves sparsely irregularly observed. uses novel approach elastic shape mean estimation, planar curves treated complex functions full Procrustes mean estimated corresponding smoothed Hermitian covariance surface. combined methods elastic mean estimation proposed Steyer, Stöcker, Greven (2022). See Stöcker et. al. (2022) details.

title: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves
text: simplest way obtain elastes install directly CRAN. Type following command R console: can install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("elastes") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("mpff/elastes")

title: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves
text: Calculate smooth elastic shape mean sparse spirals.
code: library(elastes)  # define spiral curve curve <- function(t){   rbind(t*cos(13*t), t*sin(13*t)) }  # randomly draw sparse spirals with noise set.seed(18) data_curves <- lapply(1:10, function(i){   m <- sample(10:15, 1)   delta <- abs(rnorm(m, mean = 1, sd = 0.05))   t <- cumsum(delta)/sum(delta)   data.frame(t(curve(t)) + 0.07*t*matrix(cumsum(rnorm(2*length(delta))),              ncol = 2)) })  # apply random rotation and scaling to spiral curves rand_scale <- function(curve){ ( 0.5 + runif(1) ) * curve } rand_rotate <- function(curve){   names <- colnames(curve)   theta <- 2*pi*runif(1)   mat <- matrix(c(cos(theta), sin(theta), -sin(theta), cos(theta)), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)   curve.rot <- as.matrix(curve) %*% t(mat)   curve.rot <- as.data.frame(curve.rot)   colnames(curve.rot) <- names   return(curve.rot) } data_curves <- lapply(data_curves, rand_scale) data_curves <- lapply(data_curves, rand_rotate)  # compute smooth procrustes mean using a 2nd order penalty in the estimation knots <- seq(0,1, length = 11) elastic_shape_mean <- compute_elastic_shape_mean(   data_curves,   knots = knots,   type = "smooth",   penalty = 2 ) plot(elastic_shape_mean)

what: Compute an elastic full Procrustes mean for a collection of curves — compute_elastic_shape_mean
title: Compute an elastic full Procrustes mean for a collection of curves — compute_elastic_shape_mean
text: Computes elastic full Procrustes mean curves stored data_curves. Constructor function class elastic_shape_mean.

title: Compute an elastic full Procrustes mean for a collection of curves — compute_elastic_shape_mean
code: compute_elastic_shape_mean(   data_curves,   knots = seq(0, 1, len = 13),   type = c("smooth", "polygon"),   penalty = 2,   var_type = c("smooth", "constant", "zero"),   pfit_method = c("smooth", "polygon"),   smooth_warp = function(i) 0,   eps = 0.05,   max_iter = 50,   verbose = FALSE,   cluster = NULL )

title: Compute an elastic full Procrustes mean for a collection of curves — compute_elastic_shape_mean
text: data_curves list data.frames observed points row. variable one coordinate direction. variable t, treated time parametrization, additional coordinate. knots set knots mean spline curve type "smooth" linear srv-splines used results differentiable mean curve "polygon" mean piecewise linear. penalty penalty use covariance smoothing step. use '-1' penalty. var_type (experimental) assume "smooth", "constant" "zero" measurement-error variance along t pfit_method (experimental) "smooth" "polygon" smooth_warp (experimental) controls weighting original smoothed observations iterations, pfit_method == "smooth". eps algorithm stops L2 norm coefficients changes less eps max_iter maximal number iterations verbose print iterations cluster (experimental) use parallel package faster computation

title: Compute an elastic full Procrustes mean for a collection of curves — compute_elastic_shape_mean
text: object class elastic_shape_mean, list entries type "smooth" mean modeled using linear srv-splines, "polygon" constant srv-splines coefs spline coefficients knots spline knots variance sample elastic shape variance data_curves list data.frames observed points row. First variable t gives initial parametrization, second variable t_optim optimal parametrization curve aligned mean. attributes 'rotation', 'scaling', 'translation' 'dist_to_mean'. Use get_procrustes_fit get elastic full Procrustes fit. fit see fit_mean

title: Compute an elastic full Procrustes mean for a collection of curves — compute_elastic_shape_mean
code: curve <- function(t){   rbind(t*cos(13*t), t*sin(13*t)) } set.seed(18) data_curves <- lapply(1:4, function(i){   m <- sample(10:15, 1)   delta <- abs(rnorm(m, mean = 1, sd = 0.05))   t <- cumsum(delta)/sum(delta)   data.frame(t(curve(t)) + 0.07*t*matrix(cumsum(rnorm(2*length(delta))),              ncol = 2)) })  #randomly rotate and scale curves rand_scale <- function(curve){ ( 0.5 + runif(1) ) * curve } rand_rotate <- function(curve){   names <- colnames(curve)   theta <- 2*pi*runif(1)   mat <- matrix(c(cos(theta), sin(theta), -sin(theta), cos(theta)), nrow = 2, ncol = 2)   curve.rot <- as.matrix(curve) %*% t(mat)   curve.rot <- as.data.frame(curve.rot)   colnames(curve.rot) <- names   return(curve.rot) } data_curves <- lapply(data_curves, rand_scale) data_curves <- lapply(data_curves, rand_rotate)  #compute smooth procrustes mean with 2 order penalty knots <- seq(0,1, length = 11) elastic_shape_mean <- compute_elastic_shape_mean(     data_curves,     knots = knots,     type = "smooth",     penalty = 2     ) plot(elastic_shape_mean)

what: elastes: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves — elastes
title: elastes: Elastic Full Procrustes Means for Sparse and Irregular Planar Curves — elastes
text: Provides functions computation functional elastic shape means sets open planar curves. package particularly suitable settings curves sparsely irregularly observed. uses novel approach elastic shape mean estimation, planar curves treated complex functions full Procrustes mean estimated corresponding smoothed hermitian covariance surface, combined methods elastic mean estimation proposed Steyer, Stöcker, Greven	(2022). See Stöcker et. al. (2022) details method.

text: Fits elastic full Procrustes mean open, planar curves. usually called compute_elastic_shape_mean.

title: Mean estimation for open planar curves. — fit_mean
text: srv_data_curves list data.frames srv vectors row.curves knots set knots mean spline curve penalty penalty use covariance smoothing step. use '-1' penalty. var_type (experimental) assume "smooth", "constant" "zero" measurement-error variance along t pfit_method (experimental) "smooth" "polygon" max_iter maximal number iterations type "smooth" linear srv-splines used results differentiable mean curve "polygon" mean piecewise linear. eps algorithm stops L2 norm coefficients changes less cluster cluster object use bam call verbose print iterations smooth_warp (experimental) controls weighting original smoothed observations iterations, pfit_method == "smooth".

title: Mean estimation for open planar curves. — fit_mean
text: list entries type "smooth" "polygon" coefs coefs srv spline coefficients estimated mean knots spline knots penalty penalty used covariance estimation distances distances mean fit list containing t_optimsoptimal parametrizations G_optimsoptimal rotations b_optimsoptimal scalings n_optimsoptimal re-normalization n_iternumber iterations convergence gram mean basis Gram matrix, cov_fit covariance smoothing objects final iteration, cov_pca cov coef matrix pca object final iteration pfit_coefs mean basis coefs smoothed pfits final iteration

what: Helper functions for calculating Procrustes data curve from rotation, scaling and translation parameters. — get_Procrustes_fit_from_param
title: Helper functions for calculating Procrustes data curve from rotation, scaling and translation parameters. — get_Procrustes_fit_from_param
text: Compute Procrustes fit given optimal rotation, scaling translation.

title: Helper functions for calculating Procrustes data curve from rotation, scaling and translation parameters. — get_Procrustes_fit_from_param
code: get_procrustes_fit_from_param(   data_curve,   rot,   scale,   plength,   trans,   norm_factor )

title: Helper functions for calculating Procrustes data curve from rotation, scaling and translation parameters. — get_Procrustes_fit_from_param
text: data_curve data.frame observed points curve. row one point, variable one coordinate direction. variable t, treated time parametrization, additional coordinate. rot rotation (radian). scale scaling. plength polygon length original curve. trans translation. norm_factor normalization factor smooth curve estimate.

title: elastes 0.1.5.9000
text: Changed T/F TRUE/FALSE function’s default parameters. Documented missing return values exported functions. Removed ‘par()’ call ‘elastes.Rmd’ vignette.

title: elastes 0.1.5
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Fixed bug gram matrix wrongly calculated piecewise constant basis irregular knots (#10). Updated DESCRIPTION documentation. Added tests plotting evaluating means. Clean existing tests removing duplicate unnecessary computations. Added vignette getting started. Created pkgdown site.
